thread.title: After spectacular summer, Chase misfortune bites Kyle Busch again
thread.title_full: After spectacular summer, Chase misfortune bites Kyle Busch again

title: After spectacular summer, Chase misfortune bites Kyle Busch again
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest After spectacular summer, Chase misfortune bites Kyle Busch again Kyle Busch is one of the best pure talents of his generation, but throughout his career, Busch endured an annual tradition: Watching his Chase for the Sprint Cup hopes somehow blow up. Post to Facebook After spectacular summer, Chase misfortune bites Kyle Busch again Kyle Busch is one of the best pure talents of his generation, but throughout his career, Busch endured an annual tradition: Watching his Chase for the Sprint Cup hopes somehow blow up. Check out this story on USATODAY.com: http://usat.ly/1Rkvsm5 Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. 4 To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs After spectacular summer, Chase misfortune bites Kyle Busch again Jeff Gluck , USA TODAY Sports 12:28 p.m. EDT October 2, 2015 USA TODAY Sports' Brant James on what everybody is talking about, what to watch for, and who will win in the AAA 400 at Dover International Speedway. USA TODAY Sports Despite his regular-season success, Kyle Busch has had some bad luck in Chase for the Sprint Cup races over the years. (Photo: Jasen Vinlove, USA TODAY Sports) 117 CONNECT 166 TWEET LINKEDIN 4 COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
DOVER, Del. — Kyle Busch is one of the best pure talents of his generation and has every tool necessary to win a championship. But throughout his career, Busch endured an annual tradition: Watching his Chase for the Sprint Cup hopes somehow blow up. 
“It’s September, October, November right?” Busch said Friday at Dover International Speedway. “That’s typically the time of the season in which something seems to happen to myself.” 
It’s true: The strangest twists of fate strike Busch during the Chase, which has resulted in him never coming close to winning the title despite 33 career Cup wins (only one of which came during the Chase). Matt Kenseth on pole after Dover qualifying rained out 
Just look at last week’s race at New Hampshire Motor Speedway, when he had an inexplicable flat tire early in a run and crashed into the wall. 
“That just doesn’t make any sense,” Busch said of getting a flat tire after only 23 laps on it. “That has absolutely nothing to do with over-camber or over-using the brakes or melting a bead or anything like that. You can’t blow one that fast — but we can or I can.” 
The resulting 37th-place finish left him 13th in the standings heading into an elimination race Sunday at Dover, after which only 12 drivers will advance. Dover: Most recent wins for legends; pressure cooker for Chase drivers 
And it’s not like this is a new occurrence for Busch. Last year, the Joe Gibbs Racing driver was having his most consistent and solid start to the Chase yet, seemingly in prime position to advance to the third round. 
All he had to do was stay out of trouble at Talladega Superspeedway, so the smart strategy play was to drop to the back. 
But then a wreck happened in front of him and Austin Dillon didn’t hit the brakes in time, slamming into Busch from behind. Just like that, Busch’s Chase was done again. 
PHOTOS: Behind the wheel with Kyle Busch Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Kyle Busch was born May 2, 1985. He became a full-time Sprint Cup driver in 2005. Andrew Weber, USA TODAY Sports Busch celebrates winning the Food City 300 at Bristol Motor Speedway on August 21, 2015. Peter Casey, USA TODAY Sports Busch celebrates his victory in the Toyota SaveMart 350 at Sonoma Raceway on June 28, 2015. Ed Szczepanski, USA TODAY Sports Busch celebrates with wife Samantha and newborn son Brexton after winning the Xfinity Series race at Michigan International Speedway on June 13, 2015. Carlos Osorio, AP Medical crews attend to Busch after crashing during the Xfinity Series race at Daytona International Speedway on Feb. 21, 2015. Busch suffered a broken leg in the wreck and missed several weeks of the 2015 season. Andrew Weber, USA TODAY Sports Kyle Busch celebrates winning the Kansas Lottery 300 Nationwide Series race at Kansas Speedway on Oct. 4, 2014. Jasen Vinlove, USA TODAY Sports Kyle Busch celebrates after winning the Auto Club 400 at Auto Club Speedway in Fontana, Calif., on March 23, 2014. Todd Warshaw, Getty Images Kyle Busch and his wife Samantha, shown in 2013 at Dover International Speedway, married in Chicago on Dec 31, 2010. Jerome Miron, USA TODAY Sports Kyle Busch celebrates in victory lane after the Cheez-It 355 at Watkins Glen International on Aug. 11, 2013. Timothy T. Ludwig, USA TODAY Spor Kyle Busch celebrates after winning the NRA 500 at Texas Motor Speedway on April 13, 2013. Chris Graythen, Getty Images for Texas Motor Speedway Kyle Busch celebrates in victory lane after winning the Royal Purple 300 at Auto Club Speedway on March 23, 2013. Gary A. Vasquez, USA TODAY Sports Busch makes a pit stop during the FedEx 400 Benefiting Autism Speaks at Dover International Speedway. His pit crew won the 2011 Mechanix Wear Most Valuable Pit Crew Award. Matthew O'Haren, USA TODAY Sports Busch still is looking for his first Sprint Cup title. Jerome Miron, USA TODAY Sports Busch celebrates in victory lane with his mother, Gaye, after winning the Nationwide race at Darlington Raceway on May 10, 2013. Geoff Burke, Getty Images Busch captured the 11th pole of his career at Bristol Motor Speedway on March 15, 2013. He also won one of the Budweiser Duels in Daytona. Robert Laberge, Getty Images for Texas Motor Speedway Busch celebrates one of the four Sprint Cup wins in 2009. Steve Helber, AP Busch poses with wife, Samantha, on Feb. 18, 2012, after winning the Budweiser Shootout at Daytona. Andrew Weber, USA TODAY Sports Busch celebrates winning the the Crown Royal 400 Sprint Cup race on his birthday in 2009 at Richmond International Raceway. He was the second driver to achieve the feat. Steve Helber, AP Busch holds up a jersey sent from Joe Gibbs, owner of Joe Gibbs Racing and then coach of the Washington Redskins, during a news conference announcing that Busch would drive the No. 18 Cup car for JGR beginning in 2008. Mike McCarn, AP Busch became the youngest Sprint Cup winner, besting Donald Thomas’ record by a mere four days. Paul Connors, AP Busch celebrates his victory in the Checker Auto Parts 500 at Phoenix International Raceway in 2005. This would be his second career Sprint Cup win. Mark J. Rebilas, USA TODAY Sports Busch competed in his first full Sprint Cup season in 2005 and finished 20th in points. Alan Marler, AP Busch became the youngest driver to capture Rookie of the Year honors in 2004 in the Nationwide Series at 19. Rusty Burroughs, STR AP Busch competed in his first full Nationwide Series season in 2004 and finished second in points. He scored his first career Nationwide Series victory at Richmond on May 14, 2004. Tony Gutierrez, AP Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay
